snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said during a break in talks in Lausanne, Switzerland, that “we are pushing some tough issues, but we made progress.”
abstract: Nuclear talks with Iran lag, as negotiators debate what limits should be set on the research and development of new types of centrifuges; detailed and comprehensive agreement is to be completed by end of June.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Lausanne, and David E. Sanger from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said during a break in talks in Lausanne, Switzerland, that “we are pushing some tough issues, but we made progress.”

headline.main: Iran Nuclear Talks Lag, With Status of New Centrifuges Another Hurdle
headline.print_headline: Iran Nuclear Talks Lag, With Status of New Centrifuges Another Hurdle
